TopicTitle: Astronomer's Visual pack V3 BETA is out and it looks great!

Articles.Content:
Also the OP used my LOTUS lander for the reddit pics!! It took me a while to realize it was my lander.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

MJ

Whoa, I just sent Astronomer a PM about what lander that was... then I go to my profile and click this post... and there it is! Thanks!

And yep, his pack is exceptionally awesome!
Moved to the proper forum

Kasper, Majorjim didn't make the pack so it's not really a showcase... is it?

Well, it is an Imgur album, but he posted it to spread the news about Astronomer's awesome pack. So it should probably go in Add-on Affairs, this isn't a download post.
Hmm, good point. A link to the mod pack would be appreciated though

Moved to the proper forum

Thanks KasperVid. I wasn't sure when to put it.

Woopert, here is my lander: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/lotus-m1-rii/

Its the first craft I released so the launcher is kinda crappy. But nearly 4000 downloads aint bad.

Hmm, good point. A link to the mod pack would be appreciated though

Here you go: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/hdcloudtextures/

MJ

How do I remove the atmosphere-like glow from the Mun without removing the yellowish colour? I've tried messing around with the Alt-N menu but nothing seems to do the trick. Thanks in advance.

This is my fav out of all the E.V.E. packs out there. I ran a quick flight on Kerbin and on Laythe to see what I got:

Wow. That is beautiful.

actually sorry to bother you again but i tried to follow the installation instructions to the letter ( with the 2x clouds and maximum textures). none of the clouds are volumetric and fluffy. i need your help modding sir!

here is a picture

Edited May 12, 2014 by praise the suuun

actually sorry to bother you again but i tried to follow the installation instructions to the letter ( with the 2x clouds and maximum textures). none of the clouds are volumetric and fluffy. i need your help modding sir!

here is a picture

They won't render volumetric from the ground (unless you like liquid proccessors). They are volumetric. Fly down in those ones over the mountains.
I don't see the point of glow over bodies without atmosphere, but all of the rest seems very cool. Downloading.

I don't see the point of glow over bodies without atmosphere

If it's the same as with BetterAtmospheres then it makes terminator much more visible. Looks way better than stock.

I'm using BA (v2 or v3, I don't remember), but I'll definitely try this pack as well. Looks beautiful!

They won't render volumetric from the ground (unless you like liquid proccessors). They are volumetric. Fly down in those ones over the mountains.

I'm sure my pc can handle it and it worked just fine with 'better atmospheres v4' being visibly volumetric from the ground; even out to a fluffy render limit of 100,000 it was ok performance wise. just tell me how and I'll try

Looks great! I'll just leave this here...

(OP link points to null)
Please captain sierra if you Know how to make them volumetric to the ground, like better atmos v4, please tell me how. My ksp movie depends on it no matter how great the processing cycles!
I might replace Renaissance with this one - if just for the biolumi-Laythe, the thick storms ... to much good stuff for an old man!!
i guess i'll stick with better atmos v4. dissapointed because i love your wind currents texture.

As much as I adore Astronomer's pack, I wasn't quite happy with some things, such as the auroras, the mun's glow, the colour of duna's atmosphere and the entirety of Jool. So I edited the configs a bit and stuck some new textures in there. If anyone wants to give it a try here's the link: https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0Bwk8Zm2S3YUKaGtXSEpkbGFDc3c&usp=sharing

Is it just me, or does this pack make Kerbin really, really blue? In the startup splash screen you can't see any land at all. In LKO you can see bits of green land off to the horizon, but directly under the ship it's all blue. Is there a way to turn down the atmospheric scattering a bit?
just press alt+n while focused on kerbin and it will show you the atmospheric layers, the one using the texture "glow.png" will need changing, just move the opacity slider (marked A below RGB)
Oh, cool. I didn't know about that. I'll give it a try - thanks!
Oh, and remember to click save if you want to keep your settings for next time you play.
